author: Special Correspondent
text:
A sub-court here on Monday convicted and sentenced a youth to five years’ rigorous imprisonment in a case of attempt to murder his three relatives.

According to prosecution, K. Ramesh (26) of Namanasamuthiram village near here, attempted to murder his father Karuppiah (54), sister Sangavi (27), and cousin Durairajan (50) following some family feud over his remaining unemployed for a prolonged period. Possessing some deadly weapon, he started attacking them. The incident happened at their residence at Namanasamuthiram village on January 21, 2013. Based on a complaint by Sangavi, the Namanasamuthiram police registered a case under Sec. 307 IPC (Attempt to murder) against Ramesh and arrested him.

The Sub-ordinate Judge, P. Indirani, who found Suresh guilty, convicted and sentenced him to undergo five years’ imprisonment. The Judge also ordered a fine of Rs.10,500 on him.
title: Youth gets five years
